exceptions.exn: In environment cn : nid pts, others : seq nid Hnin : cn \ otin pts Puniq : uniq pts ptag : ttag prec : PStateT -> payload -> Prop pn_prec_safe : forall (this to : nat_eqType) (s : PStateT) (m : payload), HPn this to -> prec s m -> cohMsg {| content := {| tag := ptag; tms_cont := m |}; from := this; to := to; active := true |} s.1 this, to : nid d : dstatelet m : data Hin_pts : this \\in pts Hto_cn : to == cn Unable to unify "is_true (this \\in pts)" with "is_true (this \\in nodes)".
Wrong bullet -: Current bullet - is not finished.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
cn: nid
others: seq nid
pts: seq nid
Hnin: is_true (cn \notin pts)
Puniq: is_true (uniq pts)
ptag: ttag
prec: PStateT -> payload -> Prop
pn_prec_safe: forall (this to : nat_eqType) (s : PStateT) (m : payload), HPn this to -> prec s m -> cohMsg {| content := {| tag := ptag; tms_cont := m |}; from := this; to := to; active := true |} s.1
to: nid
this: nid
d: dstatelet
m: data

Goal:
pn_safe this to d m -> this \in nodes /\ to \in nodes

Premises:
payload = seq nat : Set
from : forall mtype : Type, msg mtype -> nat
PStateT = (nat * PState)%type : Set
nat_eqType = EqType nat nat_eqMixin : eqType
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
tms_cont = fun t : TaggedMessage => let (_, tms_cont) := t in tms_cont : TaggedMessage -> seq nat tms_cont is a coercion
pn_safe = fun (this n : nid) (d : dstatelet) (msg : data) => HPn this n /\ (exists (Hp : HPn this n) (C : coh d), prec (getStP C (pn_this_in Hp)) msg) : nid -> nid -> dstatelet -> data -> Prop
Notation seq := list
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
nodes = [:: cn] ++ pts ++ others : seq nid
HPn = fun this to : nat_eqType => this \in pts /\ to == cn : nat_eqType -> nat_eqType -> Prop
tag = fun t : TaggedMessage => let (tag, _) := t in tag : TaggedMessage -> nat
content : forall mtype : Type, msg mtype -> mtype
active : forall mtype : Type, msg mtype -> bool
cohMsg = fun (ms : msg TaggedMessage) (y : nat) => if from ms == cn then to ms \in pts /\ msgFromCoordinator (content ms) y else if from ms \in pts then to ms == cn /\ msgFromParticipant (content ms) y else True : msg TaggedMessage -> nat -> Prop Arguments cohMsg _ _%nat_scope
